bio110.name: Tales from the Genome
bio110.description: Learn the basics of genetics, with a personal twist. This class is all about DNA and how it shapes who we are.

cs046.name: Intro to Java Programming
cs046.description: Start with this basic introduction to Java programming if you've never studied the language before and practice essential computer science concepts.

cs101.name: Intro to Computer Science
cs101.description: Learn key computer science concepts in this introductory Python course. You'll learn by doing, and will build your own search engine and social network.

cs212.name: Design of Computer Programs
cs212.description: Learn how to model problems, and how to optimize performance by using some of the advanced features of Python.

cs215.name: Intro to Algorithms
cs215.description: This class will give you an introduction to the design and analysis of algorithms, enabling you to analyze networks and discover how individuals are connected.

cs222.name: Differential Equations in Action
cs222.description: Write Python code to find numerical solutions to systems of differential equations. The models you create will fight wildfires, bring spaceships back to earth, and more!

cs258.name: Software Testing
cs258.description: Learn how to catch bugs and break software as you discover different testing methods that will help you build better software.

cs259.name: Software Debugging
cs259.description: In this course you will learn how to debug programs systematically using scientific methods and build several automated debugging tools in Python.

cs262.name: Programming Languages
cs262.description: This course is an introduction to the fundamentals of programming languages. Concepts include how to specify and process valid strings, sentences and program structures.

cs271.name: Intro to Artificial Intelligence
cs271.description: This course will introduce you to the basics of AI. Topics include machine learning, probabilistic reasoning, robotics, computer vision, and natural language processing.

cs291.name: Interactive 3D Graphics
cs291.description: This course will teach you the principles of 3D computer graphics: meshes, transforms, lighting, animation, and making interactive 3D applications run in a browser.

cs313.name: Intro to Theoretical Computer Science
cs313.description: Learn the basic concepts in theoretical computer science. Discover what they imply for solving tough computational challenges.

cs344.name: Intro to Parallel Programming
cs344.description: Learn the fundamentals of parallel computing with the GPU and the CUDA programming environment by coding a series of image processing algorithms. #filters, #cuda.

cs373.name: Artificial Intelligence for Robotics
cs373.description: Learn how to program all the major systems of a robotic car. Topics include planning, search, localization, tracking, and control.

cs387.name: Applied Cryptography
cs387.description: Cryptography is present in everyday life, from paying with a credit card to using the telephone. Learn all about making and breaking puzzles in computing.

design101.name: Intro to the Design of Everyday Things
design101.description: This course will provide you with the insight to start recognizing the role of design in today’s world, and to start making better design decisions in your own life.

ep245.name: How to Build a Startup
ep245.description: Learn what it takes to build a successful startup using the Customer Development process, where entrepreneurs "get out of the building" to gather and iterate on feedback.

gt101.name: OMSCS Student Orientation
gt101.description: In this OMS Orientation, we cover several things you will need to know to be a successful OMS student.

ma004.name: Intro Algebra Review
ma004.description: A brief review of introductory algebra topics including integer operations, scientific notation, algebraic expressions, linear equations, and graphing.

ma006.name: Visualizing Algebra
ma006.description: Learn the basics of Algebra through intuition and problem solving! From fractions to factors to functions, we’ll cover a breadth of topics.

ma008.name: College Algebra
ma008.description: Gain an in-depth understanding of algebraic principles and learn how to use them to solve problems you may meet in everyday life.

nd000.name: Intro to Programming Nanodegree
nd000.description: Udacity's Intro to Programming is your first step towards careers in Web and App Development, Machine Learning, Data Science, AI, and more! This program is perfect for beginners.

nd001.name: Front-End Web Developer Nanodegree
nd001.description: Become a Front-End Web Developer by completing a variety of projects for your portfolio - become an HTML, CSS and JavaScript pro!

nd002.name: Data Analyst Nanodegree
nd002.description: Learn to clean up messy data, uncover patterns and insights, make predictions using machine learning, and clearly communicate your findings.

nd003.name: Become an iOS Developer
nd003.description: Master writing in Swift as you build five portfolio-worthy iOS apps to demonstrate your expertise as an iOS Developer.

nd004.name: Full Stack Web Developer Nanodegree
nd004.description: Learn how to create server-side, data-driven web applications that support any front-end and can scale to support hundreds of thousands of users.

nd008.name: Business Analyst Nanodegree
nd008.description: Predictive analytics is the practice of determining patterns from data to predict future outcomes and trends. Across industries, it enables high-value solutions to important business problems.

nd009.name: Machine Learning Engineer Nanodegree
nd009.description: Become a machine learning engineer and apply predictive models to massive data sets in fields like education, finance, healthcare or robotics.

nd013.name: Self-Driving Car Engineer Nanodegree
nd013.description: In this program, you’ll learn the skills and techniques used by self-driving car teams at the most advanced technology companies in the world.

nd017.name: VR Developer Nanodegree
nd017.description: Join the creative revolution! There is massive growth in the space, and job opportunities are skyrocketing, making this the perfect time to launch your VR career!

nd018.name: Digital Marketing Nanodegree
nd018.description: Gain real-world experience running live campaigns as you learn from top experts in the field. Launch your career with a 360-degree understanding of digital marketing.

nd101.name: Deep Learning Nanodegree Foundation
nd101.description: With Siraj Raval, Udacity provides a dynamic introduction to Deep Learning, using weekly videos, exclusive projects, and expert feedback to teach you the foundations of this future-shaping technology.

nd209.name: Robotics Nanodegree
nd209.description: Master skills with hands-on projects in simulated environments and on real hardware. Change our world for the better using robotics to extend our capabilities in new ways.

nd801.name: Android Developer Nanodegree by Google
nd801.description: For intermediate programmers pursuing Android mastery, this program teaches the tools, principles, and patterns that underlie all Android development.

nd803.name: Android Basics Nanodegree by Google
nd803.description: Get a solid grasp on the basics of foundational programming skills used in creating mobile apps

nd889.name: Artificial Intelligence Nanodegree
nd889.description: Learn skills and tools used by the most innovative AI teams, gain experience solving real-world challenges, and prepare for a wide variety of roles in the AI field.

ph100.name: Intro to Physics
ph100.description: Go to the places where big physics discoveries were made in the past and make them yourself. You’ll visit Italy, the Netherlands, and the UK as you learn basic physics.

ps001.name: Intro to Psychology
ps001.description: Go on a journey through psychological concepts and principles to enable you to gain a more in-depth understanding of human thought and behavior.

st095.name: Statistics
st095.description: We live in a time of unprecedented access to information. You'll learn how to use statistics to interpret that information and make decisions.

st101.name: Intro to Statistics
st101.description: Get ready to analyze, visualize, and interpret data! Thought-provoking examples and chances to combine statistics and programming will keep you engaged and challenged.

ud007.name: High Performance Computer Architecture
ud007.description: The HPCA course covers performance measurement, pipelining, and improved parallelism through various means.

ud015.name: Object-Oriented JavaScript
ud015.description: Build a variety of JavaScript objects and explore how their inheritance models affect your app's in-memory model. Gain simplicity and modularity in your own code.

ud032.name: Data Wrangling with MongoDB
ud032.description: Data Scientists spend most of their time cleaning data. In this course, you will learn to convert and manipulate messy data to extract what you need.

ud0351.name: Firebase in a Weekend: iOS
ud0351.description: This course will teach you when and why to choose Firebase as a backend for your iOS application.

ud0352.name: Firebase in a Weekend: Android
ud0352.description: This course will teach you when and why to choose Firebase as a backend for your Android application.

ud036.name: Programming Foundations with Python
ud036.description: Introductory programming class to learn Object-Oriented Programming, a must-have technique to reuse and share code easily. Learn by making projects that spread happiness!

ud061.name: Computability, Complexity & Algorithms
ud061.description: Learn tools and techniques that will help you recognize when problems you encounter are intractable and when there an efficient solution.

ud088.name: Full Stack Foundations
ud088.description: Learn the fundamentals of back-end web development by creating your own web application from the ground up using the iterative development process.

ud098.name: GT - Refresher - Advanced OS
ud098.description: This course covers the essential Operating Systems concepts students need in preparation for the rest of the GT "Advanced Operating Systems" sequence.

ud1000.name: Deploying a Hadoop Cluster
ud1000.description: Deploy your own Hadoop cluster to crunch some big data!

ud1006.name: Data Visualization in Tableau
ud1006.description: Learn the fundamentals of data visualization and practice communicating with data.

ud1009.name: Objective-C for Swift Developers
ud1009.description: Learn the distinguishing language features of Objective-C. Practice Objective-C syntax by writing classes, and writing and calling methods.

ud1012.name: Introduction to Virtual Reality
ud1012.description: If you are interested in learning more about virtual reality, this course will teach you the principles of VR technology and help you understand what you can build in VR.

ud1013.name: VR Scenes and Objects
ud1013.description: Take the first step in Unity and begin to develop VR content. Learn the principles of the Unity platform and help you understand what you can build in VR!

ud1014.name: VR Software Development
ud1014.description: Learn about the world of virtual reality programming! You will learn the basics of programming in C# and how to use it control virtual reality applications in Unity.

ud1022.name: Swift for Beginners
ud1022.description: Learn Swift, Apple's programming language for building iOS applications. Start with the basics and work your way towards completing sets of challenges in Swift.

ud1025.name: Swift for Developers
ud1025.description: Get a quick practical introduction to Swift programming basics and build your first iOS app!

ud1026.name: AutoLayout
ud1026.description: With this course, you will learn about AutoLayout and how to use stack views and constraints to create pixel-perfect UIs.

ud1027.name: Building iOS Interfaces
ud1027.description: Learn the best practices for creating iOS interfaces. Build adaptive interfaces, animate UI elements, and analyze designs from popular apps on the App Store.

ud1028.name: Passwordless Login Solutions for iOS
ud1028.description: In this course you'll implement Account Kit and Facebook Login side by side in a sample app, test our login flow on a series of common use cases, and wrap things up with an introduction to Facebook’s Graph API.

ud1029.name: iOS Design Patterns
ud1029.description: In this course, you'll explore iOS design patterns — the practical and battle-tested solutions to common problems that are used everyday by developers.

ud1030.name: Continuous Integration and Deployment
ud1030.description: In this course, you'll learn how to improve the mobile development process by using continuous integration and deployment.

ud1031.name: Server-Side Swift
ud1031.description: In this course, you'll learn how to utilize Swift as a server-side language for building end-to-end applications. That's one language (Swift) for the client and server.

ud110.name: Intro to AJAX
ud110.description: Learn how to perform asynchronous requests as you build a web app with data from Google Street View, the New York Times and Wikipedia!

ud1110.name: Introduction to Python
ud1110.description: Python is one of the most popular programming languages in the world. If you already know another language and want to expand to Python, this is the course for you!

ud120.name: Intro to Machine Learning
ud120.description: This class will teach you the end-to-end process of investigating data through a machine learning lens, and you'll apply what you've learned to a real-world data set.

ud123.name: Version Control with Git
ud123.description: Learn how to use Git, a popular Version Control System and essential tool for any developer.

ud150.name: Database Systems Concepts & Design
ud150.description: This course presents an example of applying a database application development methodology to a major real-world project.

ud168.name: Compilers: Theory and Practice
ud168.description: This course teaches the theory and practice behind building compilers for higher level programming languages.

ud169.name: Embedded Systems
ud169.description: This course takes a holistic view of the embedded system stack focusing on processor architectures, instruction sets, and the associated advanced compiler optimizations.

ud170.name: Intro to Data Analysis
ud170.description: Explore a variety of datasets, posing and answering your own questions about each. You'll be using the Python libraries NumPy, Pandas, and Matplotlib.

ud197.name: Intro to Relational Databases
ud197.description: Relational databases are a powerful tool used throughout the industry. Learn the basics of SQL and how to connect your Python code to a relational database.

ud199.name: Network Security
ud199.description: This course provides an introduction to computer and network security, including cryptography, cryptanalysis, and systems security.

ud201.name: Intro to Inferential Statistics
ud201.description: Intro to Inferential Statistics will teach you how to test your hypotheses and begin to make predictions based on statistical results drawn from data!

ud206.name: Shell Workshop
ud206.description: The Unix shell is a valuable tool for developing and deploying software. Learn the basics of this terminal-based, command-line interface.

ud245.name: Intro to jQuery
ud245.description: Learn how to access and modify the DOM with ease using jQuery!

ud248.name: Make Your Own 2048
ud248.description: Ten minutes into this class you'll make your own completely personalized version of the insanely addictive game 2048. Even if you've never coded before. Pretty cool, no?

ud256.name: Networking for Web Developers
ud256.description: You've used the Internet. Now find out more about how it works.

ud257.name: A/B Testing
ud257.description: Design and implement an A/B test to determine the efficacy of potential improvements to an online site or mobile app while specifying metrics to measure.

ud262.name: Machine Learning
ud262.description: In this course, you'll learn how to apply Supervised, Unsupervised and Reinforcement Learning techniques for solving a range of data science problems.

ud268.name: Dynamic Web Applications with Sinatra
ud268.description: Sinatra is a micro-framework for quickly developing small Ruby applications for the web. In this course, you'll learn all about Sinatra, routing, and templating.

ud270.name: The MVC Pattern in Ruby
ud270.description: In this course you’ll learn how to organize your code, and why that’s important. You’ll be using the MVC Design Pattern in the web application micro-framework Sinatra.

ud272.name: Deploying Applications with Heroku
ud272.description: Deploy your first web application using the Heroku platform and learn about the underlying mechanics of web hosting.

ud279.name: Cyber-Physical Systems Security
ud279.description: This course provides an introduction to security issues relating to cyber-physical systems including industrial control systems and critical infrastructures.

ud281.name: High Performance Computing
ud281.description: This course will give you solid foundations for developing, analyzing, and implementing parallel and locality-efficient algorithms. Offered at Georgia Tech as CS6220

ud282.name: Java Programming Basics
ud282.description: Take your first steps towards becoming a Java developer! Learn Java syntax and create conditional statements, loops, and functions.

ud292.name: HTML5 Canvas
ud292.description: Learn how you can use HTML5 Canvas to create and modify images or even interactive animations.

ud299.name: Configuring Linux Web Servers
ud299.description: Serve a data-driven web application as you become acquainted with, configure and finally secure a Ubuntu Linux web application server.

ud303.name: HTTP & Web Servers
ud303.description: HTTP is the fundamental protocol of the Web. Explore how it works using Python code and command-line tools.

ud304.name: Intro to HTML and CSS
ud304.description: Learn how to convert digital design mockups into static web pages and how to build a responsive portfolio site to showcase your work.

ud325.name: iOS Persistence and Core Data
ud325.description: Persisting data is a core skill for any iOS developer. Learn how to store app data to your device using three common techniques: NSUserDefaults, Sandbox & Core Data.

ud330.name: Authentication & Authorization: OAuth
ud330.description: Learn to implement the OAuth 2.0 framework to allow users to securely and easily login to your web applications.

ud333.name: Software Analysis & Testing
ud333.description: This course covers the theory and practice of software analysis, which is at the heart of software development processes such as diagnosing bugs, testing, and debugging.

ud353.name: Firebase Analytics: iOS
ud353.description: Learn how to grow an app's user base using Firebase Analytics, a free and unlimited analytics solution

ud354.name: Firebase Analytics: Android
ud354.description: Learn how to grow an app's user base using Firebase Analytics, a free and unlimited analytics solution

ud356.name: ES6 - JavaScript Improved
ud356.description: Learn about the changes made to the JavaScript programming language in ECMAScript 6 and how to use these new improvements to write better cleaner code.

ud357.name: Passwordless Login Solutions for Android
ud357.description: In this course you'll implement Account Kit and Facebook Login side by side in a sample app, test our login flow on a series of common use cases, and wrap things up with an introduction to Facebook’s Graph API.

ud359.name: Intro to Data Science
ud359.description: What does a data scientist do? In this course, we will survey the main topics in data science so you can understand the skills that are needed to become a data scientist!

ud381.name: Real-Time Analytics with Apache Storm
ud381.description: The world is trending in real time! Learn Apache Storm, taught by Twitter, to scalably analyze real-time tweets and drive d3 visualizations. Storm is free, open and fun!

ud388.name: Designing RESTful APIs
ud388.description: Build and secure a web server with a RESTful Developer-Friendly API that developers will love to use.

ud400.name: Human-Computer Interaction
ud400.description: This course is an introductory course on human-computer interaction, covering the principles, techniques, and open areas of development in HCI.

ud404.name: Data Analysis and Visualization
ud404.description: This course will introduce students to the field by covering state­-of-­the-art modeling, analysis and visualization techniques.

ud405.name: 2D Game Development with libGDX
ud405.description: This course explores how to use LibGDX to build 2D games that run anywhere, from web browsers to mobile devices. At the end you will create a full game, called Icicles.

ud406.name: How to Make a Platformer Using libGDX
ud406.description: This course will explore how to create a game called Giga Gal. Giga Gal is a platformer in which you run, collect energy packs, jump a bunch, and shoot enemies.

ud407.description: You will learn the most effective monetization strategies for your game, how to keep your players interested and engaged, so that your game stands out in the app store.

ud409.name: Knowledge-Based AI: Cognitive Systems
ud409.description: The twin goals of knowledge-based artificial intelligence (AI) are to build AI agents capable of human-level intelligence and gain insights into human cognition.

ud421.name: iOS Networking with Swift
ud421.description: Learn how to incorporate networking into your apps to access data from around the world. Build the On the Map app to share location and fun links with fellow students.

ud436.name: Computer Networking
ud436.description: This is an advanced Computer Networking course that delves into the latest concepts and tools used by the CN industry.

ud456.name: GitHub & Collaboration
ud456.description: Learn how to interact with remote repositories and collaborate with other developers on GitHub.

ud501.name: Machine Learning for Trading

ud507.name: Data Visualization and D3.js
ud507.description: Learn the fundamentals of data visualization and apply design and narrative concepts to create your own visualization.

ud509.name: Product Design

ud513.name: Technical Interview

ud518.name: App Monetization
ud518.description: Learn how to effectively develop, implement, and measure your monetization strategy, iterating on the model as appropriate.

ud549.name: JavaScript Testing

ud576.name: Grand Central Dispatch (GCD)

ud585.name: Intro to iOS App Development with Swift

ud595.name: Linux Command Line Basics

ud600.name: Reinforcement Learning
ud600.description: Study machine learning at a deeper level and become a participant in the reinforcement learning research community.

ud607.name: How to Make an iOS App
ud607.description: Learn the process of building an app, taking your ideas from drawing board to App Store!

ud611.name: Intro to DevOps
ud611.description: Learn all about the DevOps landscape, workflow, and a survey of the systems currently being used to support scalable software deployment.

ud615.name: Scalable Microservices with Kubernetes
ud615.description: This course is designed to teach you about managing microservices, using Kubernetes. This course is built in partnership with experts such as Google’s Kelsey Hightower.

ud617.name: Intro to Hadoop and MapReduce
ud617.description: In this short course, learn the fundamentals of MapReduce and Apache Hadoop to start making sense of Big Data in the real world!

ud651.name: Data Analysis with R
ud651.description: Data is everywhere and so much of it is unexplored. Learn how to investigate and summarize data sets using R and eventually create your own analysis.

ud719.name: App Marketing
ud719.description: This course will help you organize a strategy of identifying your perfect user, and teach you how to grow your user base by focusing your product on their needs.

ud723.name: Rapid Prototyping
ud723.description: Learning to prototype will save you time and money in the development process. You’ll create quality apps faster and have confidence in the viability of your products.

ud730.name: Deep Learning
ud730.description: Show off what you've learned in your Nanodegree program with a project that defines

ud758.name: CSE 8803 Special Topics: Big Data
ud758.description: In this course, we introduce the characteristics of medical data and associated data mining challenges on dealing with such data. We cover various algorithms and systems.

ud774.name: Xcode Debugging
ud774.description: In this course, you'll learn standard methodologies for debugging software, and how to use Xcode's debugging tools to find and squash bugs.

ud775.name: How to Use Git and GitHub
ud775.description: Learn to use version control, an important tool for any developer. The course will focus on Git, a specific version control system, and GitHub, a collaboration platform.

ud777.name: Writing READMEs
ud777.description: Documentation is an important part of the development process. Learn to write READMEs using Markdown so your code can be used by other humans!

ud788.name: UIKit Fundamentals
ud788.description: Learn the iOS UIKit framework, which is the cornerstone of creating user interfaces in all iOS apps and crucial for any iOS Developer to be intimately familiar with.

ud803.name: Intro to JavaScript
ud803.description: Learn the fundamentals of JavaScript, the most popular programming language in web development.

ud804.name: JavaScript Basics
ud804.description: Learn JavaScript syntax and coding conventions that web developers use to create interactive and dynamic websites while you create an online résumé for your portfolio.

ud805.name: Software Development Process
ud805.description: Software Development Processes explores requirements engineering, architecture and design, testing, and software quality in general.

ud806.name: Get Your Startup Started
ud806.description: Acquire the know-how necessary to see your business grow towards its next milestone.

ud809.name: Health Informatics in the Cloud
ud809.description: This survey course provides a broad, forward-facing overview of contemporary health informatics within the context of the US healthcare delivery system.

ud810.name: Introduction to Computer Vision
ud810.description: This course provides an introduction to computer vision including fundamentals, methods for application and machine learning classification.

ud811.name: Intro to Progressive Web Apps
ud811.description: In this course you’ll get started working on your very first Progressive Web App - a web app that can take advantage of many features native applications have enjoyed!

ud821.name: Software Architecture & Design
ud821.description: Software Architecture and Design teaches the principles and concepts involved in the analysis and design of large software systems.

ud825.name: Android Performance
ud825.description: Performance matters to users, so it must matter to you. Learn how to identify and fix bottlenecks in your Android applications, and ensure a smooth user experience.

ud827.name: Intro to Descriptive Statistics
ud827.description: Intro to Descriptive Statistics will teach you the basic concepts of statistics that can be used to extract information from data.

ud834.name: Android Basics: User Interface
ud834.description: Learn how to design your first layout in Android! This is the first course in the Android Basics Nanodegree program.

ud835.name: Introduction to Health Informatics
ud835.description: This survey course provides a broad, forward-facing overview of contemporary health informatics within the context of the US healthcare delivery system.

ud836.name: Android Basics: User Input
ud836.description: Learn how to make your apps interactive using buttons and text! In this course you'll learn the basics of the Java programming language and how to apply them to Android.

ud837.name: Android Development for Beginners
ud837.description: Learn the basics of Android and Java programming, and take the first step on your journey to becoming an Android developer!

ud839.name: Android Basics: Multiscreen Apps
ud839.description: Learn to build multiple screens and link them together, expanding the range of apps you can create! You'll also learn how to play audio and add images to your apps.

ud843.name: Android Basics: Networking
ud843.description: This class teaches the basics of networking using Android, and is a part of the Android Basics Nanodegree by Google.

ud845.name: Android Basics: Data Storage
ud845.description: In this course, you'll learn the basics of data storage in Andriod, building your first database and an app that could be used for any small business!

ud849.name: UX Design for Mobile Developers
ud849.description: This is a design course made for developers. You'll learn UX design skills which will help you make 5-star mobile apps that your users will love.

ud851.name: Developing Android Apps
ud851.description: Build a cloud-connected Android app, and learn the tools, principles, and best practices of mobile and Android development that you'll apply to your own projects.

ud855.name: Advanced Android App Development
ud855.description: Make your app production-ready by applying advanced features like library integration, material design, widgets, receiving cloud messages, and more!

ud859.name: Developing Scalable Apps in Java
ud859.description: You will learn about challenges of building applications that can serve hundreds of thousands of users, and how you can prepare for them as a developer.

ud860.name: Browser Rendering Optimization
ud860.description: This course will demystify the browser's rendering pipeline and make it easy for you to build high performance web apps.

ud862.name: Material Design for Android Developers
ud862.description: Learn and apply the material design principles that define Android's visual language to your apps.

ud864.name: Google Maps APIs
ud864.description: This course will introduce you to the content available through the Google Maps APIs through building a real-estate listings web application step-by-step.

ud867.name: Gradle for Android and Java
ud867.description: Build bigger and better Android and Java apps using the Gradle build tool.

ud875B.name: Android TV and Google Cast Development
ud875B.description: Go where your users are: the living room! This course shows you how to extend your existing Android app to also work on Android TV, and/or with Google Cast.

ud875C.name: Android Auto Development
ud875C.description: Reach your users while they're out and about by extending your Media or Messaging app to Android Auto!

ud876-1.name: Google Location Services on Android
ud876-1.description: Enhance your apps with Google's Fused Location Provider, Activity Recognition, and Geofencing API capabilities.

ud876-3.name: Monetize Your Android App with Ads
ud876-3.description: Learn how to monetize apps using Google's AdMob to display banner and interstitial ads!

ud876-4.name: Add Google Maps to your Android App
ud876-4.description: Maps on mobile devices have changed the world for millions of users. Learn how to use the Google Maps API to extend this functionality to your apps.

ud882.name: Responsive Images
ud882.description: Go beyond image tags! Learn how to make images a part of your responsive design workflow.

ud884.name: Website Performance Optimization
ud884.description: Learn how browsers convert HTML, CSS and JavaScript into websites while you experiment with Chrome Developer Tools to measure and optimize website speed!

ud890.name: Building High Conversion Web Forms
ud890.description: Increase conversions with best practices for fast, efficient forms! Learn how to design and build web forms for users on any device.

ud891.name: Web Accessibility
ud891.description: Get hands-on experience making web applications accessible. You’ll understand when and why users need accessibility, then you’ll dive into how to implement.

ud892.name: Web Tooling & Automation
ud892.description: In this course, you’ll learn how to setup your development environment and save a lot of time and effort with automatic optimization.

ud893.name: Responsive Web Design Fundamentals
ud893.description: Learn and practice strategies for developing websites that look great on every device! Made with Google's Pete LePage.

ud894.name: Front End Frameworks
ud894.description: Explore and build interactive, single-page applications with popular JavaScript frameworks!

ud897.name: Client-Server Communication
ud897.description: Learn how a client communicates with a server, including HTTP's request and response cycle, HTTP/2 and HTTPs.

ud898.name: JavaScript Promises
ud898.description: Learn how to simplify asynchronous work with Native JavaScript Promises!

ud899.name: Offline Web Applications
ud899.description: Learn how to develop offline-first web application using Service Workers and IndexedDB.

ud902.name: Learn Swift Programming Syntax
ud902.description: This course focuses on the syntax of the Swift programming language. By the end of the course, you'll be able to apply Swift essentials to building iOS apps.

ud915.name: Educational Technology
ud915.description: This class is an an introductory course about educational technology offered as CS6460 at Georgia Tech where it is a part of the Online Masters Degree (OMS).

ud919.name: Model Building and Validation
ud919.description: This course will teach you how to start from scratch in understanding and paying attention to what is important in the data and how to answer questions about data.

ud923.name: Introduction to Operating Systems
ud923.description: Introduction to Operating Systems teaches the basic operating system abstractions, mechanisms, and their implementations.

ud953.name: Linear Algebra Refresher Course
ud953.description: Learn linear algebra by doing: you will code your own library of linear algebra functions!
